title: E-Space sheds more light on sustainable megaconstellation plan
summary: Megaconstellation startup E-Space is preparing to deploy the first of potentially hundreds of thousands of satellites on a Rocket Lab mission slated for no earlier than April 19.

title: Antonov shortage threatens delivery delays for the biggest satellites
summary: A shortage of Ukrainian Antonov aircraft raises the prospect of more delays for satellite projects already bogged down by supply chain issues.

title: SpaceX to launch quartet of mini geostationary satellites in 2023
summary: Startup Astranis has purchased a dedicated Falcon 9 launch from SpaceX for four miniature geostationary communications satellites. Known as MicroGEO, the comparatively...

title: Artemis lunar lander contenders revisit team rosters for round two
summary: Companies interested in a NASA competition for a second Artemis lunar lander are using this week’s 37th Space Symposium to find partners that may result in different teams than the earlier lander competition.

title: ESA continues talks with NASA on ExoMars cooperation
summary: The European Space Agency is continuing discussions with NASA on how the agencies can work together to revive ESA’s ExoMars mission after ending cooperation with Russia.

title: Space Force to shore up cybersecurity as threats proliferate
summary: The most likely form of attack facing satellite networks does not happen in space but on the ground, where hackers seek to exploit vulnerabilities.

title: NASA’s SLS moon rocket, SpaceX’s Falcon 9 share the scene at Kennedy Space Center
summary: NASA’s Artemis 1 moon rocket and SpaceX’s Falcon 9 shared the scene Wednesday at the Kennedy Space Center — the first time since 2009 that rockets have stood on both pads at Launch Complex 39.

title: As Russia prepared to invade, U.S. opened commercial imagery pipeline to Ukraine
summary: Leading up to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, U.S. intelligence agencies more than doubled its procurement of commercial electro-optical imagery

title: NASA Selects Universities for Space Station Research Opportunities
summary: Five universities were chosen by NASA for grants to provide students with opportunities to design research experiments that will be conducted on the International Space Station.

title: SpaceX’s second private astronaut launch on track after Falcon 9 static fire
summary: Update: SpaceX has successfully fired up Falcon 9 booster B1062 and confirmed that Crew Dragon’s second private astronaut launch is on track...
